title: [BUG] `mlflow gc` fails in deleting runs from postgres backend store due to foreign key constraints

labels.name: area/sqlalchemy
labels.description: Use of SQL alchemy in tracking service or model registry

body:
### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.

### MLflow version

1.26.1

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Docker
- **Python version**: 3.9.5
- **yarn version, if running the dev UI**:


### Describe the problem

The code to delete runs tries to delete the record from `runs` table directly, which fails due to the foreign-key constraints in related tables like `metrics`, `latest_metrics`, and 'tags'.

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/store/tracking/sqlalchemy_store.py#L585-L592

Either make the database schema ON DELETE CASCADE, or run the following adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60088889/how-do-you-permanently-delete-an-experiment-in-mlflow

```
DELETE FROM latest_metrics WHERE run_uuid=<id>;
DELETE FROM metrics WHERE run_uuid=<id>;
DELETE FROM tags WHERE run_uuid=<id>;
DELETE FROM runs WHERE run_uuid=<id>;
```

### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

Run the docker-compose file at https://github.com/Jason-CKY/MLOps-workflows/blob/main/docker-compose-mlflow.yml,
exec into the mlflow container and run `mlflow gc`

### Other info / logs

_No response_
